name: Hindustani Classical
description: Hindustani Classical is one of the two major traditions of Indian classical music, developed in North India. It emphasizes improvisation, ragas, and talas, with performances often lasting for hours.

name: Carnatic Classical
description: Carnatic music is the South Indian classical tradition, known for complex ragas, devotional themes, and compositions by saint-poets like Tyagaraja. It focuses on precision and lyrical depth.

name: Qawwali
origin: Sufi Shrines of North India & Pakistan
description: Qawwali is a form of Sufi devotional music performed at dargahs and festivals. It features powerful vocals, rhythmic clapping, and mystical poetry expressing divine love.

name: Bhajan
description: Bhajans are Hindu devotional songs dedicated to gods and goddesses. They are usually sung in temples and spiritual gatherings with simple melodies.

name: Ghazal
description: Ghazal is a poetic form of music that conveys deep emotions of love, loss, and spirituality. It blends Persian and Indian influences with lyrical recitation and melody.

name: Dhrupad
description: Dhrupad is the oldest surviving form of Hindustani classical music, marked by slow, meditative alap and powerful compositions, often performed in royal courts.

name: Thumri
description: Thumri is a semi-classical form focusing on romantic and devotional lyrics. It emphasizes emotional expression and improvisation, often associated with Kathak dance.

name: Kriti
description: Kriti is the main compositional form of Carnatic music, structured with pallavi, anupallavi, and charanam. It conveys devotion and intricate musical ideas.

name: Folk (Bihu Songs)
description: Bihu songs are part of Assamâ€™s folk tradition, sung during Bihu festival. They are lively, romantic, and celebrate agriculture, love, and community.

name: Baul
description: Baul music is the mystical folk tradition of Bengal, blending bhakti and Sufi philosophies. Bauls sing about divine love and simplicity of life.

name: Bhangra
description: Bhangra is a vibrant folk music and dance form of Punjab. Originally linked to harvest festivals, it has evolved into a global pop-fusion genre.

name: Dadra
description: Dadra is a semi-classical style performed in 6-beat rhythm. It is lighter than thumri and focuses on romantic or devotional expressions.

name: Tappa
description: Tappa is a semi-classical style known for fast-paced, intricate note patterns. It evolved from Punjabi folk songs.

name: Abhang
description: Abhang is a form of devotional music sung in praise of Lord Vithoba. It is deeply rooted in Marathi bhakti traditions.

name: Sufi Music
description: Sufi music expresses mystical devotion and union with the divine. It blends Persian, Arabic, and Indian influences.

name: Rabindra Sangeet
description: Rabindra Sangeet refers to the songs written and composed by Rabindranath Tagore. They blend classical, folk, and Western styles with lyrical poetry.

name: Shyama Sangeet
description: Shyama Sangeet is a genre of Bengali devotional songs dedicated to Goddess Kali, characterized by deep emotion and devotion.

name: Lavani
description: Lavani is a folk music and dance tradition of Maharashtra, often performed with fast beats, humor, and socio-political themes.

name: Ghoomar
description: Ghoomar is a traditional folk music and dance of Rajasthan, performed by women in colorful attire, celebrating joy and festivals.

name: Film Music (Bollywood)
description: Indian film music, especially Bollywood, is a fusion of classical, folk, and Western styles. It is the most popular form of music in India, influencing millions worldwide.
